reviews.review: you better have the time for play ALL the game
Classic! Still a great play, even in 2019.  Beautifully long campaign, and it's problem-solving beyond the standard run-and-shoot.
Best Game. Revolutionary. God-like.
Good
Absolute Classic

You know Half-Life 2?

Well imagine if that game were great, and not a boring, badly paced slog, and you have a good summary of Half-Life 1.

Play it, love it, then play it again. 

P.S. The fan remake "Black Mesa" is also great!

Some scientist named Gordon manages to single-handedly fight off an entire military force as well as defeat a giant all-powerful alien and his armies... After dying and loading quicksaves hundreds of times that is.

Overall, a game with great charm, with very compelling world building that keeps you immersed despite the outdated graphics. However, some levels were definitely better than others and the gameplay could get repetitive at times... I'm looking at you endless ventilation shafts!
Half-Life 3 out of 3

Half life is the worst piece of shit that I love. It has bad out of date graphics, abysmal sound quality, and so much jank I almost castrated myself out of anger and frustration. The difficulty should only be set to normal, any lower you're a pussy who can't play, or any higher and you will obliterate your computer accessories out of rage without a second thought. The worst part is, the game is good enough to hold you over and straight up get you addicted to the gun play and story. It is an evil game that is like piece of shit tricking you into thinking its a bowl of ice cream, and you'll eat it anyway. It will stay in my heart and mind until  I die. Fuck this game to hell, I love it.

Where it all started.
Even if old, totally worth the play.
It's HALF-LIFE! Need I say more?

I've had this game sitting in my library for some time, and I have finally completed it after multiple times I had started the game and then just... stopped.

Half-Life 1, for a game that was released in 1998, is fantastic and definitely holds up to being a fun game to play even today! (But then again, many old video games are still fun to play.)

I will admit that personally, it is a difficult game in some areas. (*cough* Xen *cough*) And the controls at times weren't helpful for area's where you have to move around carefully. But despite these things, I still enjoyed myself, and I would recommend this game to anyone who is interested in experiencing the beginning of an amazing series!

A good half life game never gets old

Half Life is, simply put, a landmark title in PC fps history. It's a hard game, sometimes deaths can feel cheap and some moments will make you want to pull your hair off. I don't think I would bother finishing this game if not for the quick save feature.

Despite this, I can't deny Half Life's importance to the industry. Without it, Valve wouldn't exist, without it Steam wouldn't exist. It's an historic game that every gamer should experience at least once.

I was skeptical of Half Life, hearing all the buzz about the series being legendary and fun with a cliff-hanging story. It's $0.99 Steam sale price tag was pretty appealing, and I figured, "If I don't like it, I lost only $0.99. Who cares?" I bought it about a year ago and never got a chance to start it until a few days ago. Here are my opinions:

This game is jaw-droppingly intuitive for it's time. My goodness. The moment that I was shown that "crouch jumping" was a mechanic in the tutorial, I was blown away (personally) by the idea of it being utilized in a shooter game. I grew up with shooters like Call of Duty Black Ops and Battlefield 3 for years. They are nowhere near this level of mechanics in my personal opinion, despite the fact Half Life was released in 1998. 

The game play is super slick for it's first play through. Small issues and a few confusing destination points, but none to make me even consider not recommending the game anyway. The game has really nice (mostly) indicators of where you need to go or what you need to do. The color of pipes heading in a clear direction, named signs, glowing control panels to signify that you completed something (turned on the gas, turned on the fuel, etc). Sometimes it was awkward, admittedly.  I'd only recommend that if you are having a hard time with a specific part, check a play through on YouTube. As for the mobs that you fight, they can be hard, but mostly fair and never felt impossible at the Normal difficulty. Think about what is near the enemy if you aren't sure how to beat it (grenades near a large mod, for example). Save A LOT if you are worried about getting YEETED like I was. It saved me a lot of grief. 

The story is fun and develops at an interesting pace over time. No cut scenes in the game, all centered around dialogue and listening to background announcements or voices. Let the NPCs do the talking so you catch what's happening. It's almost like the story isn't forced on you necessarily (you go from point A to B, but don't *have* to hear the dialogue), but its part of the background as you continue onward. If you skip over the story too much, you will be surprised by what happens next. I never knew that the Half Life's story would go *this way*, but it did, and it was a super cool experience. One of the best cliff-hanging endings for sure.

I beat the game in about 4 days just over 15 hours on Normal mode. It was super fun and I am sold on playing the series. This game is epic and deserves the praise it gets. 

99 cents out of 100 cents for me. If you have been on the fence about it, do yourself a favor and play this game. 

TLDR; Worth every penny and 100% recommend it. Fantastic game with very few short comings that can be dealt with fairly easily with some brief research. Get it while it's on sale for $0.99 to buy more games (even more Half Life, dang it!). Heck, I would have bought it for $10.

По сути игра в комментариях не нуждается, но всётаки напишу.
Хотя вторую халфу прошёл уже давно, до первой руки не доходили ещё, но посмотреть на легендарную игру хотелось. Общее впечатление - классика. Графика жутко устарела, но геймплей на уровне. Нет однообразия процесса, разные враги, разный игровой процесс... красота. Вижу, что для своего времени эта игра была революцией.
Что раздражало всю игру - это мелкий прицел, на некоторых уровнях его вообще не видно, но прицеливаться надо. В остальном ничего критичного.
Общее впечатление - хоть положительное, но перепроходить желания не возникает.

En las 10 horas que jugamos (aprox si revisas todos los entornos y no mueres seguido) siendo Gordon Freeman el juego te presenta nuevas mecancias y una jugabilidad que definio los juegos futuros de valve, es lineal, pero sin embargo puede probar muchas formas de matar a los enemigos, la historia es atrapante con las pocas palabras que nos ofrecen y al final diraas que carajos y te animaras a buscar un resumen de la historia.
Es un clasico y hay que jugarlo si o si en algun momento de tu vida.
Este es el juego que cambio de rumbo los FPS conocidos hasta el momento.

Disclaimer: this is my first time playing this game, and this review is therefore unbiased in the nostalgia criteria. Half life one is one of the rare shooters where the corridors you run aimlessly through feel well-crafted and well designed. The guns are plentiful and satisfying to use. The game also has a eerie atmosphere that sent shivers down my spine throughout my playthrough. Great game.
